definitions.example: The inside of the building has been extensively restored.

definitions.definition: The left-hand side of a road if one drives on the left, or right-hand side if one drives on the right.
definitions.example: On a motorway, you should never pass another vehicle on the inside.

definitions.definition: The side of a curved road, racetrack etc. that has the shorter arc length; the side of a racetrack nearer the interior of the course or some other point of reference.
definitions.example: The car in front drifted wide on the bend, so I darted up the inside to take the lead.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) The interior organs of the body, especially the guts.
definitions.example: Eating that stuff will damage your insides.

definitions.definition: A passenger within a coach or carriage, as distinguished from one upon the outside.
Of or pertaining to the inner surface, limit or boundary.
definitions.example: The inside surface of the cup is unpainted.

definitions.definition: Nearer to the interior or centre of something.
definitions.example: All the window seats were occupied, so she took an inside seat.

definitions.definition: Originating from, arranged by, or being someone inside an organisation.
definitions.example: The reporter had received inside information about the forthcoming takeover.

definitions.definition: (of a person) Legally married to or related to (e.g. born in wedlock to), and/or residing with, a specified other person (parent, child, or partner); (of a marriage, relationship, etc) existing between two such people.
(of a pitch) Toward the batter as it crosses home plate.
definitions.example: The first pitch is ... just a bit inside.

definitions.definition: At or towards or the left-hand side of the road if one drives on the left, or right-hand side if one drives on the right.
definitions.example: the inside lane of the motorway

definitions.definition: Within or towards the interior of something; within the scope or limits of something (a place), especially a building.
definitions.example: It started raining, so I went inside.
It was snowing, so the children stayed inside.

definitions.definition: Intimately, secretly; without expressing what one is feeling or thinking.
definitions.example: Are you laughing at us inside?

definitions.definition: Within the interior of something, closest to the center or to a specific point of reference.
definitions.example: He placed the letter inside the envelope.
The job was finished inside two weeks.
